item.title: Staffing Requirements
item.description: Problem Determining how many people to hire in order to trim your product can be very difficult. Approach You give us the ranges of yields you expect to experience and how quickly you believe your employees can process the product. We can also factor in the fact that delays occur and sometimes can prevent other jobs from being performed. You tell us what you are willing to pay and how long the shifts you plan on scheduling have to be.

item.title: Mission
item.description: Small businesses struggle to thrive in this environment as wholesale prices fall and profit margins dwindle. As scientists concerned about the future of the planet and as entrepreneurs passionate about productive direction of capital, we are committed to helping the cannabis industry become more efficient, less wasteful, and give your business the resources you need to thrive. Our why goes beyond the money we will make together and encompasses a holistic mission to help you do better in your enterprise.

item.title: Forecasting
item.description: Problem Everything starts with a conversation. We consider the challenges unique to your business and compile a list of your ideas for potential solutions. Approach We dig deep into your company’s data to discover opportunities and problem areas. By using cutting-edge mathematical and computer-science tools, we simulate potential revenue streams to gain deeper insights into your plans for growth. Outcome We present you with a variety of options to achieve your goals as well as the associated risk profile for each decision.

item.title: Market Research
item.description: Problem Business owners are too busy managing day-to-day operations to devote any significant amount of time to researching. Decisions about the potential size of markets for new products are difficult to make without an understanding of the influence of estimation. Uncertainties at each step of the research process can compound and lead to conclusions about the potential revenue to be wildly inaccurate. Approach We identify the quantities of interest relevant to your specific problem and then hone in on what data to collect.

item.title: Data-Driven Agriculture
item.description: Problem The Green Rush has resulted in a skewed marketplace subject to price volatility. Diversification is the key to weathering the storm of wild market swings. Identifying strategies to find a sustainable market niche is becoming a necessity. Approach We can help you identify optimal conditions for any strain, experiment with diversification and reinvestment strategies, and generate projections to attract investors. Less water. Less fertilizer. Less waste. Fewer pesticides. We are all collective stewards of our environment.

item.title: Quality Testing & Extraction
item.description: Problem Testing equipment has some natural variation built in to it that scientists are used to handling. However, classical statistical methods fail to address the natural variability present in different batches of product. Approach The approach we take is rooted in cutting-edge computational mathematics to maximize the utility of information and address the underlying uncertainty in potency inherent to the cannabis plants. We can use the latest developments from simulation-based optimal experimental design to adapt your testing regiments to budgetary and temporal constraints.

item.title: Business Development
item.description: Problem Growth is central to survival. Understanding where inefficiencies lie in your business can help catapult you to the next level. Approach We aim to provide you with clear and concise information to address your most pressing questions and concerns. Outcome We identify problems and find new sectors for expansion. By using cutting-edge mathematical and computer-science tools, we simulate potential revenue streams to gain deeper insights into your plans for growth.

item.title: Cannabis Consumption Enterprises
item.description: Problem The Social Consumption License created by [Initiative 300][1] in Denver, CO is so new that very little information exists online. A client approached us to perform a preliminary investigation into what is required to get started. Approach We compiled a report that categorized the main obstacles and linked to resources for accomplishing the requirements. The focus was on clarity of exposition and brevity. Outcome The client decided the location requirements were prohibitively expensive and chose not to pursue the project further.

item.title: Support for Startups
item.description: Problem Funders want to know the risks of their ventures, and we bridge the gap between their concerns and your ambitions. Approach We help you actualize goals into reality by crafting rigorous business plans. As you already know, big plans come with big unknowns. Let us quantify them. By helping you identify and assess risks, we allow your business to try new ideas without sacrificing potential profits. Outcome We turn idealistic goals into realistic implementation strategies.

item.title: Location
item.description: REQUIREMENTS No residential zones. Must be at least 1000ft from schools, child care locations, city-owned recreational centers, or drug/alcohol treatment facilities. CCEs must be established in an area which will give community support to the existence and operation of the enterprise (see below). Proof of possession of the premises where the CCE is located with a valid zone-use permit and most recent certificate of occupancy.

item.title: Social Consumption License
item.description: Problem A client approached us with interest in exploring the feasibility of opening up a new Cannabis Consumption Enterprise in Denver, CO (our home-base!). The passing of Initiative 300 to legalize designated areas for the consumption of cannabis products was exciting, but the legal hoops to jump through are numerous, so it is no surprise that there is a severe paucity of operational businesses. At the time of this writing (mid-2018), only two are operational.

item.title: Community
item.description: REQUIREMENTS For any suitable location, take note of all registered neighborhood organizations (RNO) in the district. You should receive written approval/endorsement from at least one such eligible organization. Craft formal plan to create positive impacts in the neighborhood where the licensed premises are located. The full outline of what constitutes licensing requirements can be found in Sec. 6-210 of the DRMC. CHALLENGES Find the organizations with which you will engage to craft a plan for community engagement.

item.title: Administration
Design
item.description: REQUIREMENTS A health and sanitation plan for sanitization and cleaning of cannabis consumption accessories to be rented or otherwise made available for use. Information on Health Inspections can be found on Denver’s government website. A marijuana waste plan that includes a detailed description of how employees will dispose of any Waste that is left, abandoned, or otherwise not consumed on the premises. An odor control and abatement plan in the same form and substance as would be required in DRMC Sec 4-10, and any rules promulgated thereto, if the applicant intends to allow smoking or vaping of marijuana within the Designated Consumption Area (DCA).
